variant.affiliation: University of Rochester Rochester, NY 14627, USA
variant.note: Manuscripts should be received by 1 April 1987.
variant.sectionHeader: ANNOUNCEMENTS FOURTH CONFERENCE ON ARABIC COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS
variant.bodyText: The Linguistics Department of the Social and Economic Research and Study Center in Tunis is organising this conference in collaboration with the Computer Science Department of the FSEG-Faculty, Sfax, the Faculty of Arts in Tunis and the IBLV of Tunis. For further infor- mation, contact
variant.figure: Dr. Ridha SOUISSI C.E.R.E.S. 23 rue d'Espagne 1000 Tunis Recette principale telephone (+216) 248 053
variant.sectionHeader: ICCH 1987 EIGHTH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON COMPUTERS AND THE HUMANITIES
variant.subsectionHeader: 9-12 April 1987, University of South Carolina, Columbia, South Carolina
variant.bodyText: The Association for Computers and the Humanities and the Department of Computer Science of the University of South Carolina are pleased to announce the Eighth Inter- national Conference on Computers and the Humanities, to be held on Palm Sunday weekend to coincide with academic variations in North America and abroad. For further information, contact
variant.table: ICCH87 c/o Professor Robert L. Oakman Department of Computer Science University of South Carolina Columbia, SC 29208, USA AILA SYDNEY 1987 EIGHTH WORLD CONGRESS OF APPLIED LINGUISTICS 16-21 August 1987, University of Sydney, Australia Announcements For information write to: Department of Linguistics University of Sidney NSW Australia 2006
variant.bodyText: Two new books in the Cambridge University Press series have just been published: Computational Linguistics: An Introduction by Ralph Grishman; and Language and Spatial Cognition: An Interdisciplinary Study of Prep- ositions in English by Annette Herskovits. Semantic Interpretation and the Resolution of Ambiguity by Graeme Hirst is expected shortly. Books under contract and in various stages of production are: Machine Translation — Theoretical and Methodological Issues by Sergei Niren- burg; an English translation of Generation automatique de textes en langues naturelles by Laurence Danlos; General- ized Phrase Structure Grammars — Head Grammars and Natural Languages by Carl Pollard. [UPDATE: In addi- tion, one contract offer has been made and five manu- scripts are under review.] Manuscripts and editorial inquiries should be sent to Aravind Joshi Computer and Information Science University of Pennsylvania Philadelphia, PA 19104, USA (+215) 898-8540 joshi@upenn.csnet. Information for ordering is provided at the end of this issue.

These proceedings are available only from: IKS e.V. Poppelsdorfer Allee 47 D-5300 Bonn 1 WEST GERMANY Telephone: +49/228/735645 EARN/BITNET: uPK000@DBNRHRZ1 INTERNET: UPK000 %DBNRHRZ 1 .BITNET WISCVM.WISC.EDU The price is 95 DM within Europe and 110 DM for air delivery to non-European countries. Please pay in advance by check to the address above or by bankers draft to the following account: Bank fur Gemeinwirtschaft Bonn Account no. 1205 163 900, BLZ 380 101 11
